job.title: Research Scientist, Experimental Quantum Computing
job.description: Minimum qualificationsbrul liPhD degree in Physics Electrical Engineering Quantum Information other related area or equivalent practical experienceli liExperience with operating and calibrating quantum systems li liExperience with hardware interfacing programming and Pythonli liExperience contributing to research communities or efforts eg publishing papers at conferencesli brbrulPreferred qualificationsbrul liExperience with cryogenic operation and cryogenic signal delivery li liExperience with signal processing li liExperience with micro fabrication li liExperience with microwave or optical engineering and measurement li brbrulstronguAbout The JobbrbrustrongAs an organization Google maintains a portfolio of research projects driven by fundamental research new product innovation product contribution and infrastructure goals while providing individuals and teams the freedom to emphasize specific types of work As a Research Scientist youll setup largescale tests and deploy promising ideas quickly and broadly managing deadlines and deliverables while applying the latest theories to develop new and improved products processes or technologies From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures our research scientists work on realworld problems that span the breadth of computer science such as machine and deep learning data mining natural language processing hardware and software performance analysis improving compilers for mobile platforms as well as core search and much morebrbrAs a Research Scientist youll also actively contribute to the wider research community by sharing and publishing your findings with ideas inspired by internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the worldbrbrThe hardware team focuses on laying the technological scientific and engineering foundations for making largescale quantum computing a reality Our architectures are based on superconducting qubits that are cooled near absolute zero and controlled by high speed signals The key challenge is achieving and maintain high fidelity quantum operations as we scale up Our effort is based on the successful development of gates signal delivery hardware benchmarking techniques quantum control and quantum devicesbrbrAs a Research Scientist youll work with other research scientists and engineers to address these exciting challenges which lie at the intersection of physical insight metrology and engineeringbrbrResearch happens at Google everyday on many different embedded teams throughout the company Our research reaches the user through both services and products such as Search Maps Google Assistant Google Translate Google Cloud and our computing storage and networking infrastructure To achieve this were working on a wide variety of projects that utilize the latest stateoftheart technologies that push the boundaries of what is possiblebrbrstronguResponsibilitiesbrbrustrongul liFocus on understanding the fundamental aspects of our quantum system and improving its performanceli liDevelop metrology tools to characterize system performanceli liDevelop gates control solutions and automated calibrations and benchmark on qubits li liCharacterize and design nextgeneration quantum devicesli liCharacterize nextgeneration signal delivery and classicalquantum interfaces li brbrulGoogle is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories consistent with legal requirements See also Googles EEO Policy and EEO is the Law If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation
